title: https://www.myetherwallet.com/ unusable through Tor Network.

labels.name: stale
labels.description: PRs or Issue that are inactive

body:
- **I'm submitting a ...**

  - [ ] Feature request
  - [x] Bug report

<!--
- **Feature Request**

  - Briefly explain the feature you would like us to implement
  - What are the current issues this feature will solve
  - Is this feature cross compatible with other ethereum networks
  - Are you willing to help us with development support if required
  - Where can this be added? e.g: `/interface`, `/create-wallet`, etc.
-->

- **Bug Report**

  - What is the current behavior?
    - Numerous network errors and exemption stack

  - If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem
    - Install Tor Proxy
    - Install Google Chrome Browser
    - Route Google Chrome through Tor Proxy, exempt localhost
    - Install Trezor Bridge
    - Navigate to `https://www.myetherwallet.com/`
    - Note Cloudflare Catcha requirement
    - Note "Network Error" popup
    - Select Access My Wallet
    - Note "Network Error" popup
    - Note "Failed to Fetch" popup
    - Select Hardware -> Trezor
    - Choose "Always allow for this device"
    - Note 5x "Network Error" popup
    - Select Address
    - Accept Terms
    - Access Wallet
    - Note Something went wrong exemption stack (shown below)

  - What is the expected behavior?
    - No network errors or exception stack
  - What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
    - Privacy
  - Please tell us about your environment:
    - Operating system
      - Windows 10
    - Browser and version
      - Google Chrome Version 74.0.3729.169 (Official Build) (64-bit)
  - Other information (e.g. detailed explanation, stacktraces, related issues, suggestions how to fix, links for us to have context, eg. stackoverflow, gitter, etc)


  - Where can this be found? e.g: `/interface`, `/create-wallet`, etc.
    - `https://www.myetherwallet.com/interface`
@brianddk For this Network problem, you could get help from [tor team](https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor)

> you could get help from [tor team](https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor)

Networking is good, problem is the cloudflare CDN MEW is using.  Reasonable enough to black-list exit-nodes, but it does mean that it can't be accessed through Tor.

Cloudflare has an option to allow Tor, but the site owners have to request it.  It usually defaults to blacklisting tor.
@brianddk we're looking into enabling this. Will update you once we have more info
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed within 10 days if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
